text: Minacraga similis is a moth in the family Dalceridae. It was described by S.E. Miller in 1994.Dalceridae genus list It is found in southern Venezuela and probably adjacent northern Brazil. The habitat consists of tropical wet forests. The length of the forewings is 14 mm. Adults are coloured as Minacraga disconitens. Adults have been recorded on wing in February., 1994: Systematics of the Neotropical moth family Dalceridae (Lepidoptera). Bulletin of the Museum of Comparative Zoology 153(4): 1-495. title: Minacraga similis
